HY_OAS.name: High Yield Option-Adjusted Spread
HY_OAS.description: Spread between high-yield corporate bonds and US Treasuries. Higher spreads indicate increased credit risk and market stress.

IG_OAS.name: Investment Grade Option-Adjusted Spread
IG_OAS.description: Spread between investment-grade corporate bonds and US Treasuries. Widens during market stress and credit concerns.

VIX_Index.name: CBOE Volatility Index
VIX_Index.description: Market's expectation of 30-day forward-looking volatility. Known as the 'fear gauge'. Values >20 indicate elevated fear, >30 indicate high fear.

U3_Unemployment.name: U-3 Unemployment Rate
U3_Unemployment.description: Official unemployment rate. Rising unemployment indicates economic weakness and increased systemic risk.

USD_Index_Broad.name: US Dollar Index (Broad)
USD_Index_Broad.description: Trade-weighted value of USD against major trading partners. Higher USD typically indicates flight to safety (risk-off behavior).

ChicagoFed_NFCI.name: National Financial Conditions Index
ChicagoFed_NFCI.description: Measures stress in financial markets. Positive values indicate tight/stressed conditions, negative values indicate loose conditions.

BTC_Daily_Return.name: Bitcoin Daily Return
BTC_Daily_Return.description: 24-hour percentage change in Bitcoin price. Positive returns may indicate healthy risk appetite and reduced systemic stress.

normal.description: Market conditions within normal statistical bounds

elevated_stress.description: Heightened market stress, approaching 2 standard deviations

crisis.description: Severe market dislocation, exceeding 2 standard deviations
